data.title: Feature Films
data.meta_description: The rolling hills and quaint historic architecture of Northumberland County has made a perfect backdrop for multiple feature films for many years - from romantic comedies, to biopics and horror films, film history in Northumberland is extensive.
data.text:
Feature Films Shot in Northumberland

Northumberland County has been honoured to host multiple film crews for a wide variety of movies. From romantic movies to dramas, comedies and even a Stephen King horror movie series, our communities have seen it all. Check out the movies below and see if you recognize any Northumberland County landmarks.

Port Hope

The Michelle Apartments (1994)

Shot at the St. Lawrence Building on Walton Street

Tommy Boy (1994)

Starring Chris Farley and David Spade Shot on Walton Street and Queen Street

The James Mink Story (1995)

Starring Lou Gossett Jr. and Kate Nelligan Shot in a house at Penryn Park

To Die For (1995)

Starring Nicole Kidman

Shot on Ward Street and King Street

Mother’s Day (1996)

Shot on Walton Street

The Wishing Tree

Shot in Don Roger’s private residence

The Pact (2002)

Starring Megan Mull

Shot along the banks of the Ganaraska River

Orphan (2007)

Shot at top of Dorset Street

IT (2017)

Starring Jessica Chastain, Finn Wolfhard and Bill Skarsgard

Shot downtown Port Hope

IT Chapter Two (2019)

Starring Jessica Chastain, James McAvoy, Bill Hader, Finn Wolfhard and Bill Skarsgard

Shot downtown Port Hope

Happy Town (2010)

Starring Sam Neil

Shot on Walton Street, Port Hope

Closing the Ring (2006)

Starring Shirley MacLaine, Christopher Plummer and Neve Campbell

Opening scene shot at Perrytown, Port Hope

Country Gold (1991)

Shot on Walton St, Port Hope

One More White Christmas (1999)

Starring Andy Griffith and Naomi Judd

Shot in downtown Port Hope

Love of Olivia (2000)

Starring Louis Gossett Jr. Shot on Dorset Street.

Fighting Words (2001)

Shot at Proctor House, Brighton; Heritage Centre, Warkworth; Main Street, Cobourg
